IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: VGF constructed and operates a continuing care retirement community in Spring, TX specifically designed to meet the physical, social and psychological needs of elderly and infirm persons, including but not limited to housing, buildings, structures, equipment, furnishings, programs and related health and other services contributing to their health, security, happiness and physical and mental well-being.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Minister to the physical, social and psychological needs of elderly and infirm persons, including but not limited to housing, buildings, structures, equipment, furnishings, programs and related health and other services contributing to their health, security, happiness and physical and mental well-being.
IRS990.Description: VGF has constructed and is operating a continuing care retirement community in Spring, TX specifically designed to meet the physical, social and psychological needs of elderly and infirm persons, including but not limited to housing, buildings, structures, equipment, furnishings, programs and related health and other services contributing to their health, security, happiness and physical and mental well-being.

OtherLiabilities.Description: Payable Lutheran Social Services of the South

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: On April 1, 2009 VGF adopted the provision under ASC Topic 740, Income Taxes, that clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an entity's financial statements and prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for financial statement disclosure of tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return. VGF evaluates uncertain tax positions, if any exist, under this provision. VGF accounts for uncertainty of income taxes based on a "more-likely-than-not" threshold for the recognition and de-recognition of tax positions, which includes the accounting for interest and penalties relating to tax positions. At the adoption, there was no liability for uncertain tax positions due to the fact that VGF's federal income tax status was not considered an uncertain tax position. VGF currently does not have any tax positions that it would consider uncertain at March 31, 2010.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: To finance and refinance the construction of a senior living community.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The board reviews and approves the filing of the entity's Form 990.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: VGF doesn't have a written conflict of interest policy, however it does follow the written conflict of interest policy of its controlling entity. The controlling entity requires disclosure of interests that could give rise to a conflict, and it monitors and enforces compliance with the policy at its regular board meetings. VGF follows the whistleblower policy of its controlling entity.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Village at Gleannloch Farms, Inc. uses the following process to establish the compensation of the Chief Executive Officer: The Chair of the board of directors, on an annual basis, appoints a Personnel Committee, comprised of five members of the board of directors. None of these members has a "conflict of interest" as defined in the instructions to Part VI, Form 990. The Personnel Committee votes unanimously to approve the compensation arrangements. The details of such arrangements are also shared with the full board of directors. The committee uses a wide range of data as to comparable compensation for similarly qualified persons in functionally comparable positions at similarly situated organizations in establishing compensation for the CEO. This data includes not-for-profit organizations, including other Lutheran organizations, charities, foundations, associations, higher education, governmental, and health care services.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: VGF makes its governing documents and financial statements available to the public upon request, public placement of financials on the web, and annual disclosure statement to the Texas Department of Insurance.
The entire board assumes responsibility for review of the audited financial statements and selection of an independent accountant to audit the financial statements.
